page.title: 12Living in Bean near the A.2
page.content: The A.2 trunk road affects our lives because of the noise and the fumes. Also rubbish can come from the cars and lorries. The A.2 is quite near our house. Every morning on the way to school I talk to my brother, but when we cross the bridge where the traffic goes I can't hear a thing. When they built the road they had to cut a way through the middle of Darenth Woods. Now the two parts are joined together by a bridge. Our class stood on this bridge to do a traffic survey. We counted over 160 vehicles travelling each way in five minutes. This was at 10.30 a.m. and not during the rush hour. People who live near the A.2 sometimes have to pay for double glazing to keep out the noise. Where there are trees between the road and the houses, it is much quieter.
